questions.text: A 56-year-old woman is brought up because of progressive memory loss, weakness, diarrhea without nausea or vomiting, and several falls over the past 6 months. She was treated for tuberculosis 10 years ago. She drinks a pint of vodka daily. Examination shows glossitis and a hyperpigmented rash on her face and arms. On mental status examination, Short-term memory is impaired; she can recall 0 out of 5 objects after 10 minutes. Which deficiencies is most likely present in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vitamin B3 Vitamin B3 (niacin) deficiency results in a constellation of clinical findings known as pellagra , which can be remembered with the 4 D's: Diarrhea Dermatitis Dementia Death This patient's presentation is concerning severe niacin deficiency, and urgent vitamin B3 supplementation is indicated to prevent further deterioration.

Highyeild:

Common causes of pellagra include : Insufficient niacin intake Chronic alcohol consumption (as is the case here) Carcinoid syndrome

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option: A . While vitamin B1 (thiamine) deficiency can be caused by chronic alcohol consumption and result in anterograde amnesia, it is also associated with wet beriberi (high-output cardiac failure), dry beriberi (peripheral neuropathy), and/or Wernicke encephalopathy (oculomotor dysfunction, gait ataxia, confusion), none of which is seen in this case. Option: B. While vitamin B2 (riboflavin ) deficiency can cause glossitis , it is also associated with angular cheilitis and stomatitis , neither of which is seen here. Option: C . While vitamin B6 (pyridoxine) deficiency can be caused by chronic alcohol consumption or TB treatment (isoniazid use) and result in glossitis and seborrheic dermatitis , it is also associated with cheilitis, stomatitis, and seizures , none of which is seen in this case.

questions.text: The commonest psychiatric illness in India is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Depression The major depressive disorder has the highest lifetime prevalence (almost 1-7 percent) of any psychiatric disorder. It is the most frequent psychiatric illness in India and worldwide.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option: A. The prevalence of schizophrenia in the general population is 1%. Option: B. Among substance use disorders, tobacco use disorder is the most frequent, followed by alcohol use disorder. Option: D. The most recent survey reported the prevalence of GAD in India to be 5.8%.
